pros: Relatively close to my home.
cons: Nursing pay could be better. Physician attitude towards nursing staff is fair to poor. Management is great at identifying problems of safety or nursing concerns, but doesnt seem to have any interest rectifying them. As long as there are plenty of meetings about the problems they get swept under the rug. As long as they can check the box that a problem has been identified and discussed it must be sufficient to keep their Joint Commission standing and Magnet status. Not a stellar way to run a hospital and it shows in employee turnover. Medical benefits are outrageously expensive as well, considering we dont come close to the staff salary caps of other MGH locations. The employer match of 0.5 percent of employee contribution is also dismal for anyone planning on retiring before the age of 93.

pros: I was shown many facets of IT and allowed to lead and contribute to several large scale projects
cons: Sometimes days were slightly mundane / tedious

pros: Friendly work environment, staff works well together

pros: Teamwork driven work environment, great staffing ratios, lots of support staff - i.e. respiratory, social work.

pros: I was looking for a new position working in a bigger hospital system with supportive management. I believe I have definitely found that at WDH. I feel challenged and appreciated. I have grown in my position in a short time in the OR within my position and I continue to be part of decisions and growth in the right direction.
cons: The longevity of the OR staff is a negative aspect of the OR. Lots of resistance to welcome new employees and push back for change and growth for the better. Some tension amongst their staff. High turnover on the short time I have been employed there.

job_title: Clinical Data Associate in Dover, NH
pros: I loved working there at first
cons: Then covid happened they have redeployed to so many jobs, a lot of people are burnt out

pros: Friendly staff, high quality care, makes me proud to say I work here.
cons: MGH taking over has not given any benefit to staff. Our insurance coverage is worse, the employee perks we used to have like “shop on the spot” are gone and when you need to call for help with a technology or HR related problem it’s very difficult to get an actually WDH person on the phone.  The technology is moving backwards with changes to the Kronos system and getting rid of the virtual desktop on the inpatient nursing units. We have been told a request has been placed to give us back the VDI option but to not get our hopes up because we’re part of a bigger group now.   The hospital used to have a small town community feel and now it’s just big business with no regard for the staff’s concerns. Our pay does not compare with other Partner’s facilities and if they want to come in a change everything at least pay the staff competitively. We can’t keep good nurses because they know they can get better pay and benefits elsewhere.

job_title: Clinical Practice Leader in Dover, NH
pros: Great work environment, great affiliations
cons: Best employer around! Wonderful environment!

pros: Hospital looks like a hotel, all private patient rooms, and easy parking. Nursing team is fantastic, team oriented, and friendly!
cons: Terrible staffing- unapproved vacation time because unit can't staff the floor, management does not support staff in any way, no communication between doctors and other consulted doctors/teams, and terrible nursing pay for a Magnet hospital. Not a lot of respect for nursing from Doctors, nurses for the most part are not included in rounds/ care-plans, or given any pertinent information such as "patient is going to surgery at 1000", most updates are given from the patient or family member (how sad).

pros:
Staff and management, together, form a caring community, intent on serving patients and supporting one another. There are numerous opportunities for professional and personal growth. Employee tenure is very high. The organization is forward-looking. (And,  to top it off, this is a beautiful area, on Great Bay (Atlantic Ocean) with easy access to the White Mountains.)
nnected with metro Boston.)
cons: Despite normal medical crises, this is a relatively calm area--a negative if someone is looking for a frenetic place to work. Compensation is competitive but not necessarily on a par with that in cities to the south. Job seekers have to value  quality and seek achievement.

review_title: You won't find a better place to work.
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Dover, NH
pros: First of all, WDH is a Magnet hospital.   It is not easy to achieve this designation, and it is a  testament to the great patient care and involvement of direct care nurses in clinical decisions.    The teamwork here is second to none.  I actually worked here, relocated for a number of years and came back.  I can tell you from experience that you won't find a better working environment where everyone truly takes care of each other while taking care of our patients.
cons: Seriously... there aren't any!

job_title: Interventional Radiographer Tech III in Dover, NH
pros: A very professional environment . They are an excellent teaching facility with room to grow as a professional. I would highly recommend employment with this company.
cons:
There are times that the policies and procedures got in the way of realistic care.
But the intentions are good .

pros: Friendly, collaborate environment.  The benefits are great and employees seem to genuinely care.
cons: Professional growth can be stunted depending on which department you work in due to a large group of "Lifers".

pros: The staff at the hospital care for patients like family.  This group of nurses is really working to be competitive and provide quality care.
cons: Although there is a lot of change currently in healthcare, there is a resistance to change in the facility.  The hospital has many long time employees who view the work as what has always been done, instead of making changes for the better.

pros: It takes 4 weeks to get hired. Strongly consider other options please! Pay range for Revenue is 17 to 22 an hour. We get 200 hours vacation to start. Pay is weekly.
cons: The equipment is ancient. The management has had a high turn over rate. New management about every year. The coders were just outsourced to India. They don’t do efax or fax com to save paper. You get a half hour and a 15 minute break. We are part of the hospital in the revenue department at Broadway. It’s a 7 minute walk from the car to the parking lot. The parent hospital partners has announced administrative staff should work from home until June 2021. If you’re going to be part of the Med Rec, Registation, Referral or Revenue team at Broadway? Know that isn’t an option for you even though we don’t face patients. We’ve been told if we do grab a mask to use it for a couple weeks before getting a new one. We aren’t spaced out 6 feet a part. People aren’t being told to wear masks at their desks because “Cubicle walls” even though our own hospitals research has suggested C19 is airborne. They aren’t doing pulse ox or fever checks. People that had a fever and waited a week for a test result? Had to use their vacation time. They couldn’t work from home even though we’d been doing it for months. There are people in here coughing and sneezing and refuse to leave and get tested because they don’t want to use their PTO to wait for results. And partners (Parent hospital) has said if you need to work from home you should to avoid exposing co-workers. The Directors stance? Be thankful you even have a job. A coworker told the director that people aren’t washing their hands when they leave the bathroom. The managers excuse was that people are afraid of germs? We all brought it to HR that we were concerned about being in the office all smushed in like sardines. We got a generic answer form back “you are back in the office at the supervisors discretion”

review_title: Supported by leadership, surrounded by compassionate coworkers, and encouraged for the future.
job_title: Learning and Development Manager in Dover, NH
pros: Evidence based best practices in both clinical and non-clinical settings. Growth opportunities for every individual. Community focused organization.
cons: With growth and advances comes change, and sometimes at a rapid pace.

job_title: Payroll/Accounts Payable Representative in Dover, NH
pros: Great environment to work in! WDH promotes educational opportunities and career advancement for their employees. They value their employees and put family first. They offer great benefits and several employee activities.
cons: I cannot think of any stand out Cons to being employed here. The positives definitely outweigh the negatives by far!

pros: Promote personal improvement such as education. Have adopted a shared governance model that is working well on most units. A great place to work!
cons: Accountability of management is lacking mostly with managers who have been in the organization "forever"! Overall there really aren't too many negatives.

pros: Flexible hours, great location, excellent co-workers, pleasant environment, always staying on top of technology
cons: Starting to lose the small city feel and becoming more corporate

pros: As a newer employee, the experience here has been everything that was shared during my interview process. Great organization filled with amazing people. The management team is open, transparent and supportive, creating a wonderful culture that is felt throughout the organization.
cons: Increased awareness into the benefits of being part of MGH
